pageTitle: Is there such a thing as a legacy super-wide useable on m43?: Micro Four Thirds Talk Forum: Digital Photography Review
textBeforeTable: Flat view Next unread Next Previous First Parent Forum Complain Reply to thread   Reply with quote   Thanks! Sara Is there ANY legacy glass which has a short enough focal length to be super-wide (below 12mm, I already have a 14mm) on m43? ....so I was thinking, of all the lenses I do and will use, one for super-wide land- and city-scapes will be the one I'll most tolerate being manual-focus! ANYWAY, landscapes don't pose. Generally they give you all the time in the world to fiddle. They don't move if you need to take a longer exposure because of low light... I toyed with a legacy 50mm f1.8 for a
